column2: Bödvarr Ribspreader is the chieftain of the Rotblood Tribe, savage in conduct and devout in worship of Nurgle.
Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.
The Rotblood chieftain is handsomely blessed by the Lord of Decay.
A pact had been forged with the Skaven of Clan Fester in the Empire city of Stromdorf, and Bödvarr will see it fullfilled. The Skittergate will open, and the civilized lands shall burn.
Some Bile Trolls speciments are less virulent than the norm, and Bödvarr relies heavily on those.
Bödvarr surrounds himself with those Rotblood Berserkers who know no fear but that of seeing their chieftain's displeasure.
The Lord of Decay has been fond of his Rotblood children, and the flesh of Rotblood men is marred heavily by his benediction.
Attribute: Causes Frenzy when fighting against Dwarfs
Bödvarr Ribspreader is a civilized man's nightmare made manifest, the worst of what the North can spew forth.
Bödvarr Ribspreader is the chieftain of the Rotblood Tribe, savage in conduct and devout in worship of Nurgle.
At the start of every battle there is a chance for each unit under Bödvarr's command to receive Nurgle's blessing of Perfect Vigour, Immune to Psychology, Encourage and Cause Fear.
Bile Trolls are feared by all, even by their famously stupid kin. They aren't feared for their combat prowess though, instead, no one wants to get near them and risk infection.
Bonus vs. Infantry: %+n for Marauder Berserkers
Replaces the Bile Troll Ability "Host to Terrifying Afflictions" with a milder version that doesn't affect allies.
Bile Trolls are feared by all, even by their famously stupid kin. They aren't feared for their combat prowess though, instead, no one wants to get near them and risk infection.
Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.
Bödvarr is aided by his Marauder Champion huskarls.
Passive ability: "I Will Face You Alone"
Well he would, but Bödvarr's Champions will not have their chieftain take all the glory!
Bödvarr Ribspreader is the chieftain of the Rotblood Tribe, savage in conduct and devout in worship of Nurgle.
[[col:green]][[img:icon_arrow_up]][[/img]] Summons a unit of Marauder Champions (Great Weapons)[[/col]]
Stories tell that Bödvarr's Greataxe had been dipped in Nurgle's bubbling cauldron itself. But tales aside, where this pestilent weapon strikes iron rusts and flesh festers.
Stories tell that Bödvarr's Greataxe had been dipped in Nurgle's bubbling cauldron itself. But tales aside, where this pestilent weapon strikes iron rusts and flesh festers.
Armour: %+n for Marauders, Marauder Berserkers, Aspiring Champions, and Forsaken units
Melee defence: %+n for Marauders, Marauder Berserkers, Aspiring Champions, and Forsaken units
To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.
Cull the weak of the enemy from a distance so the worthy may fight in peace.
Bödvarr slaughters in Rotfather's name, and in the heat of a worthy battle he can level his greataxe at an enemy to turn his armour into rust.
The Blightstormer calls and the Fanatics will answer!
Cooldown: %+n% to "The Lost Of The Tribe"
Winds of Magic cost: %n for "The Lost Of The Tribe"
